column5: I fly fish with a treble. You know, that way it's all skill.

here's a tip i got from a local pro in downtown sault ste. marie...  when salmon fishing gets real tough he likes to equip with low viz fluoro and a 5/O treble with a bell sinker on one of the hooks and a roe bag on there.  i find even the most reluctant fish can't resist.
It has begun....
Omg what a night couldn't keep the fish off. See u soon bronte. :-)
is it salmon run already?? refresh me chewy... lolz
Nope the carp run.
carp ... salmon ..... there's a difference?
who run, who??
See Spot run. Run, Spot, run! Run! Run! Run!
Please god not yet - I predict the first "Are the salmon running in Bronte yet?" thread within days
We're stocking up on marshmallows for camping if anybody needs some...just sayin'
All stocked up here.   LMAO
I didnt know marshmallows work for salmon  I thought marsmallow is for snag ers lol  how do I know these??
I got the earplugs!
Dude, you can't fish chinnies without earplugs!!!!   Don't ya know they just love those things?
Michigan Crickets are my preferred lure.
On a #12 or #14 hook they wont even take a sniff , I should have used a #6 treble hook, silly me
carp run?
goby run.....
Don't be silly. Carp, salmon and gobies don't run...They swim
I've been collecting cigarette butts
Now I know why I cant find my way back, thanks alot Dan. Im reporting you to the authorities for messing around with my trail markers, mark my words
I hooked 14 today, you guys are hacks!  Wait...I'm not supposed to use a musky treble with 5oz of lead taped to it
I use crack like Homer Simpson.  Salmon love big chunks of crack.
LOL u guys are kill in me.
You saw that King of the Hill episode too?!?!
Your right, it was king of the hill.    hahahaha.     I thought it was Homer...    Great episode.  Here is a clip
